intro: Phyllanthus mindorensis, commonly known as Mindanao phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often in mountainous regions. It has a short stem with dense foliage and produces small, yellowish-green fruits. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
